properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 5:21AM CST by NWS Green Bay WI
properties.description:
A round of snow followed by windy and much colder weather is
anticipated during the next 36 hours as an arctic cold front
surges south across the area. Snow will accompany the front, then
a short-lived but fairly intense shot of cold air will follow in
the wake of the snow.

Snow associated with the front will develop across north-central
Wisconsin mid-day today. The snow will expand south and east
during the afternoon, reaching central and east-central Wisconsin
during the late afternoon or early evening hours. Milder air will
flow into the area ahead of the front, possibly warming
temperatures enough to cause some rain to briefly mix with the
snow at the onset over central and east-central Wisconsin. The
snow over north-central Wisconsin will taper off during the
evening, though snow showers off Lake Superior will continue to
affect the snowbelt. The snow over east-central Wisconsin will
continue until around midnight before diminishing. A widespread 1
to 3 inch snowfall is anticipated across the area.

North winds will increase and become gusty as the colder air pours
into the area overnight. This will cause some blowing and
drifting of the snow, especially in east-central Wisconsin.
Temperatures will also fall sharply. By daybreak Thursday, the
combination of wind and cold temperatures will result in wind
chill indices ranging from around 20 below zero in north-central
Wisconsin to around 5 below along the lakeshore. Wind chills
around 20 below zero indicate exposed skin can suffer frostbite in
as little as 30 minutes.

Additional snow accumulations after midnight will be minor and
probably limited to the Lake Superior snowbelt and possibly some
areas near Lake Michigan. However, the cold temperatures and
blowing and drifting snow will probably hinder the efforts of
highway crews to treat the roads, and result in hazardous travel
conditions lingering through the Thursday morning commute. Flight
delays are also possible at area airports.

Be sure to plan on needing some some extra travel time if you will
be driving somewhere at any point later today through tomorrow
morning. Plan on encountering slippery roads and use extra
caution. Also plan on needing to wear warm winter clothing
Thursday due to the combination of wind and cold.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS LIKELY TO DEVELOP LATER TODAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE THURSDAY MORNING COMMUTE
